From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia


2023 black comedy mystery film by Mikhil Musale
This article needs additional citations for verification. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed.Find sources: "Sajini Shinde Ka Viral Video" – news · newspapers · books · scholar · JSTOR (December 2023) (Learn how and when to remove this template message)


Sajini Shinde Ka Viral VideoTheatrical release posterDirected byMikhil MusaleWritten byMikhil MusaleParinda JoshiAnu Singh ChoudharyKshitij PatwardhanProduced byDinesh VijanStarringNimrat KaurRadhika MadanBhagyashreeSubodh BhaveChinmay MandlekarCinematographyTribhuvan Babu SadineniEdited byDevang DesaiMusic byScore:Hitesh SonikSongs:Tanishk BagchiSwager BoyShruti DhasmanaAatman NepaliMellow DSlowCheetaShwetang ShankarPratiksha KaleProductioncompanyMaddock FilmsDistributed byPen Marudhar EntertainmentRelease date
27 October 2023 (2023-10-27)
Running time114 minutes[1]CountryIndiaLanguageHindi
Sajini Shinde Ka Viral Video  is a 2023 Indian Hindi-language mystery film directed by Mikhil Musale and produced by Dinesh Vijan with his Maddock Films.[2] It stars Nimrat Kaur, Radhika Madan, Bhagyashree and Subodh Bhave as leads.[3]
The film  was released on 27 October 2023.[4]


Summary[edit]
The film is based on the story of one woman named Sajini Shinde, who is a physics teacher in one of the reputed schools of Pune. The film starts with a party scene in Singapore where Sajni, Shraddha and others are celebrating Sajni's birthday. She was apprehensive about partying at a nightclub, but her fiancé, Siddhant Kadam, boosted her confidence by asking her to behave like a modern woman. Shinde decided to let go of her inhibitions and enjoy the night. After few drinks, Sajni went for a free wheeling dance and videos are shot and accidentally posted online to the school website by Shraddha.  As a young school teacher from a small town stuck between traditional values and modern ambitions, Sajini found herself in a nightmarish situation when the video of hers went viral and evoked a adverse response in her city, in her school and in her hometown, Ahmednagar. While she returns to India, she was promptly sacked from the school by  Kalyanai, the Principal, under pressure from outraged parents and committee members. She requested the Principal to reinstate her, but she did not agree. 
Her father is a reputed theater actor, autocratic and her family is conservative. She realized that she has no where to go. The story proceeds with Sajini disappearing after writing a suicide note on her social media blaming her family and boyfriend for the suicide. Her best friend raises enough of a stink for the sleepy Pune cops to wake up.This incident turns into a major public debacle and the police are presurized into taking definitive steps to investigate Sajini's disappearance. Inspector Barot and Inspector Ram were deputed to solve the case.

Cast[edit]
Nimrat Kaur as Inspector Bela Barot
Radhika Madan as Sajini Suryakant Shinde
Bhagyashree as Kalyani Pandit
Subodh Bhave as Suryakant Shinde, Sajini's father
Soham Majumdar as Siddhant Kadam, Sajini's fiancée
Chinmay Mandlekar as Inspector Ram Pawar
Shruti Vyas as Shraddha Oswal, Sajini's friend
Sumeet Vyas as Adv. Lalit Pandit, Siddhant's lawyer
Sneha Raikar as Urmila Shinde, Sajini's mother
Ashutosh Gaikwad as Aakash Shinde, Sajini's younger brother
Rashmi Agdekar as Chhavi Joshi, Sajini's roommate and friend
Kiran Karmarkar as Yashwant Desai, Suryakant's lawyer
Kavi Shastri as Jayant
Devarshi Shah as Dhruv
Akshay Tanksale as Milind Sabne
Gurinder Pawar as Manav Rathi
Pallavi Jadhao as Jyoti
Disha Danade as Ranjana
Production[edit]
Development[edit]
The film was initially titled Happy Teacher's Day, which was later changed to Sajini Shinde Ka Viral Video.[5][6]

Filming[edit]
Principal photography commenced in September 2022.[7] Production wrapped first  schedule in November 2022.[8]

Music[edit]
Sajini Shinde Ka Viral VideoSoundtrack album by Tanishk Bagchi, Swager Boy, Shruti Dhasmana, Aatman Nepali, Mellow D, SlowCheeta, Shwetang Shankar and  Pratiksha KaleReleased3 November 2023[9]Recorded2022GenreFeature film soundtrackLength12:17LanguageHindiLabelZee Music CompanyOfficial audioSajini Shinde Ka Viral Video - Full Album on YouTube

The music of the film is composed by 
Tanishk Bagchi, Swager Boy, Shruti Dhasmana, Aatman Nepali, Mellow D, SlowCheeta, Shwetang Shankar and  Pratiksha Kale while lyrics written by Swager Boy, Shloke Lal, Rimi Dhar, Mellow D, SlowCheeta, Shwetang Shankar and Pratiksha Kale.[9]
